head.supplied: We the Undersigned beg to propose: ¶ ¶ Walter Gill Esqr., Conservator in Chief of the Forests of South-Australia, Adr. ¶ Adelaide ¶ for the fellowship of the Linnean Society, to which honor he has ...

div.p: To the Linnean Society of London
Linnean Society, London, Certificates of Fellows, Foreign Members and Associates, 1887-90.

M autograph manuscript and signature; other supporters' individual signatures. The item is dated to September 1890 as the latest that it could have been written to have been read at the first meeting of the Society's 1890-91 session on 6 November, the same date as when William Brown's certificate was read (see M to the Linnean Society of London, 23 September 1890); however it may have arrived in London at any time during the summer recess. We the Undersigned beg to propose:

Walter Gill Esqr., Conservator in Chief of the Forests of South-Australia, Adr. Adelaide
Adr. Adelaide is a marginal note with intended position indicated by an asterisk. for the fellowship of the Linnean Society, to which honor he has fair claim not only by the great forestral interests under his care, but also by his vivid interest in the elucidation of the general flora of his colony.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Robert Collie F.L.S.
Annotated front: Read 6 Nov 1890 Ballot will take place 4 Dec 1890
back: Walter Gill elected 4 Decbr 1890.
The file includes the obligation form signed and dated 17 February 1891 by Gill, undertaking to pay the fees while he remained a member. It was witnessed by C [..] Gooden.
